# Tutorials Docs

> Documentation for Tutorials Docs.

*Topics available: 3*

- [Explore user-defined instance compound assignment operators](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/whats-new/tutorials/compound-assignment-operators.md): C# 14 enables user-defined instance compound assignment operators. These operators can provide better performance by minimizing allocations or copy operations. Learn how to create these operators.
- [Explore extension members in C# 14 to enhance existing types](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/whats-new/tutorials/extension-members.md): C# 14 provides new syntax for extensions that support properties and operators, and enables extensions on a type as well as an instance. Learn to use them, and how to migrate existing extension methods to extension members
- [Declare C# primary constructors â€“ classes, structs](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/whats-new/tutorials/primary-constructors.md): Learn how and when to declare primary constructors in your class and struct types. Primary constructors provide concise syntax to declare constructor parameters available anywhere in the body of your type.
